repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: George Winfield account book and notebook
did.abstract: George Winfield was a resident of New Market, Virginia. Collection includes two volumes--an account book and a notebook containing writings, memoranda, accounts, and time tracking for farmhands. The notebook also contains a two-page description of the "Shenandoah Bridge Affair", which involved Ashby's cavalry (Confederate) and Chew's battery (Confederate).
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes two volumes--an account book and a notebook containing writings, memoranda, accounts, and time tracking for farmhands. The notebook also contains a two-page description of the "Shenandoah Bridge Affair", which involved Ashby's cavalry (Confederate) and Chew's battery (Confederate).

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George Winfield Account Book and Notebook manuscript narrative, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Paula Jeannet, Elizabeth Shesko, May 2014
Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 56-487
This collection has been given basic processing: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The George Winfield Account Book and Notebook was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 1956.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: George Winfield was a resident of New Market, Virginia.

According to the a biographical sketch, Winfield was born in 1822. It should be noted that a John Quincy Whitfield was also born in Shenandoah County in 1822, and was Captain of Company B of the 7th regiment, Virginia Cavalry, which was part of Ashby's Cavalry. The author of the volume may be in fact John Q. Whitfield or his relative [online source: A History of Shenandoah County, Virginia, 1989, and Virginia Valley Records: Genealogical and Historical Materials of Rockingham, 2010, both by John Wayland].
